data.name: Mersiv
data.body:
Mersiv, born Anderson Benoit Gallegos, has been a formidable force in electronic music since 2015, introducing audiences to his distinctive “Pretty Dark Loud” sound. His project is dedicated to offering listeners immersive auditory experiences that blend deep emotion with dynamic energy, inviting them into the present moment.

From early lessons on the piano and guitar, influenced by bands like Seether and Tool, Gallegos found electronic music as a crucial expressive outlet, especially following his mother’s passing in 2012. This pivotal moment deepened his engagement with DJing and production, cultivating a sound that provides both therapeutic escape and vibrant celebration.

With the debut of his album Pretty Dark Loud through MorFlo Records, Mersiv staked his claim in the Freeform Electronic genre. The album’s 20 tracks showcase his ability to meld emotional depth with a diverse array of sounds, from hip-hop to pop and bass, reflecting his personal journey and creative evolution.

2023 saw the release of Out of Bounds, a further exploration of musical boundaries, blending various genres and featuring collaborations with artists like Wreckno and PROBCAUSE. The album underscores Mersiv’s growing artistry and ambition.

The Out of Bounds tour electrified audiences across North America, building anticipation for his return to iconic venues like Red Rocks. In 2024, Mersiv continues to expand his presence with major festival appearances and innovative projects like the Audiosphere at The Caverns, enhancing fan experiences and solidifying his position in the music scene.

As the head of MorFlo Records, Mersiv supports artists resonating with the essence of flow, fostering a community where creativity flourishes. His commitment to using sound as a vehicle for healing and connection remains central to his work, pushing bass music’s boundaries and promoting more groundbreaking contributions to the electronic music landscape.

data.name: Prayer Handz
data.body:
That feeling when house music hits your soul - when you can’t help but feel your problems fade away and a smile make its way to your face - that spiritual experience on the dance floor is the type of gospel Prayer Handz sets out to deliver.

“Prayer Handz” has curated a style unique to his own and gained a very loyal following in recent years.

In the studio by day; this impassioned talent pulls inspiration from the worlds of Hip Hop & Soul Music, and blends them with modern day Bass and Tech House energy. This mixing pot of influences allows each release to be predictably unpredictable; with diversity and creativity flowing throughout his catalogue. In the club or festival circuit by night, his DJ sets offer high energy sounds, fast paced flow, and some live MCing to put the cherry on top of these memorable performances.

data.name: DLB
data.body:
DLB (Leevon Dance- yes that's his real last name) comes from Calgary, Alberta, and has been playing all things drum and bass since he could walk.

He has been promoting shows for 8 years under The Dojo, bringing all sorts of talent to Calgary's music scene.

Not an act to miss, don't forget your beach ball!

Trevor Galore - A.K.A. (DJ Twotimer) is a mix of bass heavy drum and bass and melodic bass music. One of the original members of the PK Crew from Calgary Alberta, Trevor has had his hand in most of Western Canada's EDM festival and concert scene over the last 20 years
Trevor started his DJ career in 1998, has been a part of the Village Stage since 2005, and been a part of Shambhala since his first visit as a patron, in 2001.

data.name: Fully Tilted
data.body:
Fully Tilted is a rising force in the underground bass scene, fusing the relentless energy of drum and bass with the raw power of dubstep. Known for high-octane sets that push sound systems to their limits, Fully Tilted delivers a genre-bending experience that blurs the line between chaos and control.

Drawing influence from UK bass culture and global electronic sounds, Fully Tilted has carved out a distinct style—dark, heavy, and unrelentingly dynamic. Whether unleashing deep rollers or face-melting drops, every set is a carefully crafted journey through bass-driven intensity.

From underground raves to festival stages, Fully Tilted brings an unfiltered passion to every performance, earning a reputation as a must-see act for fans of cutting-edge bass music. With a growing discography and collaborations on the horizon, Fully Tilted is primed to tilt the scene further in their direction

data.name: Ill.Gates
data.body:
ill.Gates is a name known by nearly all producers in the English speaking world. His songs have been in the iTunes Top Ten Electronic Charts several times. DJs play his music every weekend and fans wear their ill.Gates tattoos with pride. Some of his collaborators include 42 Dugg, Alanis Morisette, Andrew Huang, Apashe, Beats Antique, Captain Hook, CloZee, Conrank, The Dead Kennedys, Destroid, Eprom, EyeOnEyez, G Jones, Gucci Mane, ill-esha, KJ Sawka, Liquid Stanger, Masia One, Mimosa, Minnesota, Mr Bill, Opiuo, RIP Kenny, Stephan Jacobs, Stylust, UHNK, Vaedynn, and Zain Effendi (composer on Pirates of the Caribbean, Dark Knight). His ringtones can be heard on the Windows Phone and the animatronic Droids perform to his music at Star Wars Disneyland. At this point I think it’s safe to say ill.Gates is a household name.

When he isn’t composing his own music ill.Gates is teaching the next generation of musicians and providing employment opportunities through Producer Dojo, an organization he founded in 2016 with the goal of ‘launching 1000 music careers’. Producer Dojo uses a martial arts belt system to cultivate discipline in young music producers, provides them an outlet for release on the Dojo record label, and helps them create an online business selling samples, sounds and services.

ill.Gates is known for traveling the globe but has recently moved to Los Angeles in order to build a studio for the Producer Dojo, which opened in 2018.

You can catch up with the ill one at www.illGates.com and learn all about the Dojo at www.ProducerDojo.com

data.name: Super Future
data.body: On his wave as a truly unique electronic musician, Super Future is riding the momentum of his inaugural years performing at major festivals and headlining national tours. Masterfully blending a wide range of music from the bright and ethereal downtempo, to deep and heavy freeform, some sassy twerk and trap with good friend Wreckno, and even an occasional guitar solo, Super Future provides listeners with an engaging spectrum of sound that becomes a journey with every live experience. While being known for mesmerizing sound design, his fans (aka the “Super Humans”) also admire the introspective themes he brings to his art and community. Nick delivers a metaphysical experience and message to his audiences, while masterfully keeping the energy high with bass. Follow him across the country from main stages to the underground to hear the forward-thinking sound Super Future is always creating!

data.name: Andy C
data.body:
Andy Clarke began experimenting with programming breaks as a teenager; he met Ant Miles at the studios where he was working through a family connection. They began working together in Ant's converted garage studio where Andy nurtured what was to become a sublime talent for chopping up and re-programming breaks. Andy then decided to set up his own label in early 1992 with a budget of £1000. RAM - so named due to Andy's star sign, Aries - launched with his solo debut and now-highly-collectable 'Sour Mash EP'.

At the age of 15, together with Ant, Andy created magnum opus, 'Valley of the Shadows (31 Seconds)' under their Origin Unknown alias. Often referred to as the 'darkcore prototype', the track won Best Hardcore Tune at the 1993 Hardcore Dance Awards where Andy also collected the prize for Best Newcomer. By this time, his DJing career had begun to progress at a meteoric rate; he had a show on pirate station, Cyndicut FM and secured slots at key raves including Imagination, Club Elevation, Dreamscape, Innovation and Telepathy, where he became a resident. By 1994 together with Ant, he assumed another alias, Desired State, delivering masterpieces like 'Beyond Bass' and 'Here And Now'. In the same year, he began to branch out with collaborations, connecting with DJ Randall to create dancefloor smash, 'Sound Control'. Subsequent studio hook ups would involve Shimon and Moving Fusion.

Origin Unknown's 1997 album, 'Origin Unknown Presents...Speed Of Sound' won Best Dance Album at the Kiss FM Dance Awards and Best Album at the Hardcore Dance Awards, where Andy also collected the gong for Best Producer. The 1998 follow-up, 'Origin Unknown Presents...Sound In Motion', preceded the birth of RAM Trilogy; Andy C, Ant Miles and Shimon's studio hook up. In the same year Andy managed to slot in his Wednesday night radio show on London's Kiss FM between global DJing commitments. In 1999 & 2000, he took the award for Best DJ at the Knowledge Awards. His numerous high profile remix accomplishments include Busta Rhymes 'Woo Hah!' (as Origin Unknown - which won Best Remix at the 1996 Muzik Magazine Awards), Adam F 'Circles', and Jay-Z 'Can't Knock The Hustle'. Andy also won the best D&B DJ award on Drum & Bass arena in 2001 & 2002 where in excess of 90,000 people voted, and again at Accelerated Culture's 'Peoples Choice Awards' in December 2002. Andy is also the highest ranking D&B DJ in the current DJ magazine Top 100 DJs placed at No. 28.

data.name: ILLENIUM
data.body:
Nick Miller’s 10-year run as dance producer ILLENIUM has been nothing short of astounding. From humble bass beginnings to chart-topping crossover success and more than 10 billion global streams, the ILLENIUM sound has been honed into an adrenaline-rush style that fits heartfelt ballads, growling drops, emotional acoustic moments and ecstatic explosions alike. 

From his 2016 debut LP Ashes to the Grammy-nominated Fallen Embers, ILLENIUM has perfected the limitless sound that starts in his Denver studio and erupts on stages around the world. His carefully curated performances come complete with a live band and have wowed crowds at Coachella, Lollapalooza, a sold-out Madison Square Garden and three consecutive nights at Red Rocks—but that was just the lead-up to the release of his fifth album, ILLENIUM.

“It's my self-titled album, so I want it to sound exactly like what is in my head," he says, "what I enjoy, what gives me escape, what makes me feel the most.”

Boosted by hard-won confidence and a strong sense of self, ILLENIUM’s 16 tracks are sweeping, impactful, dynamic and never dull. It’s an album that sees him collaborate with his teenage heroes (Travis Barker, Avril Lavigne and more), and pushes his sound further than it's ever dared. 

With a love of rock at its core, all the drama that goes into a stadium performance, a strong narrative, and a focus on bringing fans an enthralling escape, ILLENIUM proves to be the beginning of a new chapter for an artist in his prime.

data.name: Wooli
data.body:
Wooli’s mammoth bass music imprint twists harmonic sounds into a grimy discography of varying tastes. Blending icy compositions with fiery drops, his prehistoric mark captures millions of listeners through immersive performances and heavy bass.

With a dynamic suite of releases spanning across all dance music labels and has collaborated with some of the most popular vocalists and heavy hitters. Wooli has collaborated with GRiZ, Excision, Subtronics, Illenium, Svdden Death, Tape B, Flux Pavilion and Seven Lions, showing his diverse sound of melodic landscapes as well as headbanging aggressive drops. Island (feat. Nevve) and Another Me (with Dylan Matthew) top off a collection of originals that have cemented him in charts. Gaining notoriety from the Mammoth EP (2018) and The Cave EP (2017), Wooli’s signature sounds feature sing-along verses and enthralling pounds.

Wooli’s monumental performances draw religious crowds at festival stages like EDC Las Vegas, Ultra Music Festival, Lollapalooza, Lost Lands and more.. Wooli has successfully headlined and sold out iconic venues such as Red Rocks, Wamu Theatre, Bill Graham Civic Center, The Torch Los Angeles, Echostage as his touring career continues to sail across the world.

From primeval performances to melodic masterpieces, Wooli is commanding bass music’s future as one of this generation’s most compelling acts.

data.name: Dirt Monkey
data.body:
Dirt Monkey, the alias of Patrick Megeath, embodies the identity of a forward-thinking electronic music artist in every sense. Cutting-edge sound design is the name of his game, proven by his constant releases that span a broad spectrum of genres. From dubstep, to house, to drum & bass and beyond - it’s no surprise that Dirt Monkey is regarded as a producer’s producer and a fan-favorite performer in the electronic music world.

Since unleashing his first full-length record in 2012, Dirt Monkey has consistently bestowed his fans with countless singles, collaborations, remixes, and albums throughout the past decade. Listeners can find Dirt Monkey’s tunes on a plethora of notable labels including Bassrush, Deadbeats, SubCarbon, Wakaan, Disciple Round Table, Circus Records, and more. 2019 saw the rise of Dirt Monkey’s own imprint label, 19K, with the mission to cultivate the next generation of experimental electronic music by showcasing the talents of artists both revered and up-and-coming.

Dirt Monkey took full advantage of 2021 with a packed festival season, a headline Mission Ballroom play and the release of his sixth full length album, Depolarize. He zoomed directly from festival season into the Depolarize Tour, his 40+ stop headline bus tour across the United States. Dirt Monkey rang in 2022 with a headline b2b with Boogie T at Countdown NYE, followed by multiple appearances as special guest on Subtronics’ Fractal Tour.

Dirt Monkey kicked off 2023 with his second Mission Ballroom headline, returning with an even more thrilling set and mind-blowing production, performed to a packed house. Over the next six months, he and Jantsen embarked on their 50-stop co-headline Full Circle Tour across North America. Throughout the summer, he scored prime slots at massive festivals including Lost Lands, EDC Las Vegas, Electric Forest, Bonnaroo, and more. Dirt Monkey closed out 2023 with one of the biggest endeavors of his career thus far: the release of his ambitious double album MYCELIUM SOUND. Consisting of the up-tempo and highly energetic PT. 1 and the deep and hypnotic PT. 2, the two halves of his double album together showcase the duality of his musical palate and the dynamism of his skills as a producer.

Endlessly honing his craft as a producer and a performer with an ever-growing repertoire of new music and an extensive touring schedule on the horizon, Dirt Monkey heads into 2025 at the top of his game.

data.name: Tha Funk Junkie
data.body:
In the heart of the sonic realm, where rhythm and mystery converge, resides the enigmatic maestro known only as tha Funk Junkie. Since his electrifying embrace of Shambhala Music Festival back in 2005, tha Funk Junkie has been on an odyssey through the kaleidoscope of sound.

From the pulsating depths of underground caverns to the dizzying heights of colossal stages, tha Funk Junkie has woven aural tapestries for audiences worldwide. Behind the scenes, he has been the unseen hand, sculpting the very essence of sound as a of front-of-house audio engineer, orchestrating the sound for some of the planet's most renowned events and artists.

Yet it is within the shadows of the DJ booth that tha Funk Junkie truly shines. He conjures a spellbinding fusion can be described as a mix of funky, melodic, bass-heavy vocal drum & bass. Each performance is a voyage into the unknown, where time stands still and souls dance in euphoria. Are you ready to close out the Village stage with tha Funk Junkie?

data.name: Mindful Moon Sound Healing
data.body:
Join husband-and-wife duo Quinton and Kendra Armstrong for a deeply transformative and immersive sound healing experience designed to bring participants into a state of deep relaxation, rejuvenation, and self-discovery.

In this workshop, Kendra will guide participants through breathwork while playing quartz crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, each tuned to specific chakras to support physical and energetic alignment. Quinton will complement the experience with soothing, psychedelic electric guitar riffs, using a variety of guitar pedals to create a rich, meditative soundscape.

The healing vibrations will guide participants into a deep meditative state, helping to release what no longer serves them. As the sounds move through the body, they facilitate a profound recalibration at the cellular level—resetting the nervous system, calming the mind, and inviting true rest.

Please bring a yoga mat or blanket to lie on, plus any other props to make you feel cozy (pillow, crystals, bolster).

This experience will leave you feeling balanced, relaxed, and reconnected to your highest self.

data.name: Creek St.
data.body:
Creek St. is a downtempo, electro-acoustic band weaving their diverse influences into ambient-leaning soundscapes, trip-hop–inspired beats, and live looping. Their experimental performances feature live guitar, violin, beat production, and ethereal vocals. Based in Nelson, BC, on the traditional, unceded territories of the Sinixt Peoples, Creek St.’s music transcends genres and has been showcased at a range of folk and electronic festivals. Their sound has drawn comparisons to CocoRosie, Massive Attack, and Godspeed You! Black Emperor.

Featuring Jeff Riel (More Like Space) on guitar, Chris Rosso on production and live beats, Devon Ecru on vocals, and Nella Banner on violin and vocals.

data.name: Warren Ji
data.body: Warren Ji has been pioneering methods of herbal extraction for over 10 years after starting his company 'Evolved Alchemy' in 2015.  With a background in organic chemistry, biotechnology and electrical engineering; he aims to bridge the gap between spiritual philosophy and science. From experiments in the lab to traveling to remote ruins across South America, Warren brings an ancient philosophy to understanding plants.

data.name: BiiSHoP
data.body:
Influenced by the West Coast music scene BiiSHoP's journey into the world of DJing began in 2016 as a passion project, fueled by her love for good music and the desire to create something truly from the heart. With a keen ear for selecting vibey tracks and curating a set with a range of vibrational frequencies, she takes the dance floor on a journey of movement and sound.

Through sharing music, BiiSHoP strives to awaken the energetic body within each of us, tapping into the deep, mystical power of the universal language of sound. Infused with otherworldly energies, her sound is a blend of deep, sensual bass and dark ethereal melodies, which combine to create a unique experience for listeners.

data.name: Crimson
data.body: An enigmatic figure immersed in underground, dub, and dance culture, Crimson has been producing and DJing for over a decade. His blends and productions channel elements of dubstep, garage, jungle, and ambient toward genre-defying, club-driven sounds. Raised within the high standards of Modern Math, The Hificlub, and Basscoast, Crimson embodies a deep respect for the vibrant Western Canadian music scene.

data.name: Chrome Wolves
data.body:
With over 20 years of music production experience and 15 years behind the decks, Chrome Wolves is a seasoned vet in the world of dance music. Blending deep-rooted hip-hop influences with sounds from across the globe, their sets are a journey through infectious rhythms, catchy vocals, and dynamic grooves that keep dance floors moving.

From underground venues to festival stages, Chrome Wolves seamlessly fuses cultures and genres, creating a sound that’s both boundary-pushing and deeply rooted in musical tradition. Whether it’s a late-night club set or daytime party expect nothing less than a perfect mix of unreleased music, familiar favorites and remixes that transcend borders and bring people together on the dance floor.

data.name: PRSN
data.body: PRSN is a DJ residing in Portland, OR. With a lifetime of digging, he draws on an unparalleled knack for finding the right grooves for the right moments. Weaving through tempos and seamlessly bridging gaps between the many variations in styles, PRSN’s take on dance music is wide-ranging and fresh. He’s a co-creator of Wake the Town, a dance floor-driven series of parties that shine light on unique artists from around the globe.

data.name: Leland River
data.body:
A North-Westcoast fixture - Leland River is a DJ/Producer whose genesis as an artist and human being is deeply tied to the mycelial webs of the BC festival scene.  

Trusted by many of his peers and listeners for his diverse array of productions, mixes, and adept sense for playing the right music at the right time; Leland River has been given the controls at Bass Coast, Envision, CampQ, and Shambhala for 12 years in a row.
  
From a love of hypnotizing rhythms and the low-end of dubstep, garage, grime, breaks, dancehall, jungle and techno; mixed with a disposition for emotive ambience and a love for R&B - Leland River’s music and DJ sets fit better inside a vast large venn diagram than a box.

data.name: Matthew Yausie
data.body: Matt Yausie is from Saskatoon SK where he owns and operates a gym space. At 10 Training & Athletics he provides personal training, coaching, online programming and mobility. He also duals as a yoga teacher at Pure Living Yoga. Matt is known from his athletics career in the sport of football. He brings a high energy, positive attitude, knowledge and motivation that impacts others. In the gym, yoga studio, or dance floor as a dj, Matt always shares his authenticity and compassion with others. You may remember him from last years Transformational Reset Ecstatic Yoga workshop at the Secret Garden. Be sure to check out his workshop this year if you want to Ascend in the realm of yoga, music, healing and dance.

performances.name: Unlock Your Shine
performances.body: UYS is an Empowerment and Somatic based workshop designed around radical inclusion. Practiced in a circle to create a container of CONNECTION, COLLABORATION, and BELONGING. A workshop rooted in AWARENESS, LOVE, and ACCEPTANCE, Beam will guide you through a nuanced practice of playfully deep offerings to help you align with your BRIGHTEST most AUTHENTIC self. Her teachings encourage you to begin to become aware of where you put yourself “in a box” so you can RECLAIM YOUR POWER and FREEDOM instead welcoming ALL YOUR GIFTS and DREAMS. You can expect to feel expanded, stretched, uplifted, grounded, and nurtured as we move through different play-based embodiments, animals, elements, breathwork, tapping, energy-clearing, stretching, shaking, scream therapy, group connection activities, and more allowing space for new INSIGHTS and REVELATIONS. These embodiment offerings are food for your soul. You are welcome here. Time to Unblock Your Shine!

performances.name: Feraltivity Mobility Pre Hab
performances.body: These workshops are designed to support the health, longevity, and connection of the festival community through engaging, movement-based wellness experiences. From pre-rave mobility to nervous system support and guided connection exercises, each session blends science-backed practices with rave culture energy. Attendees will leave feeling more grounded, empowered, and prepared to enjoy the event to the fullest while taking better care of themselves and each other. These offerings promote sustainable partying, personal growth, and a deeper sense of PLUR that carries beyond the dance floor.

performances.name: Paint Night by Vibrant Visions
performances.body: Join us for a fun and creative evening where no experience is needed- just a willingness to play with some iconic Shambhala imagery. Our step by step paint night is perfect for beginners and seasoned painters alike. You’ll be guided through the entire process with artist Jenny Jenn, from blank canvas to your very own masterpiece. Each step is broken down in an easy-to-follow way, with plenty of room for your own personal flair. All materials provided.

performances.name: Transformation Station
performances.body: Get ready to sparkle! Our do-it- yourself transformation station is your chance to add a little (or a lot of) shimmer to your look- you way. Perfect way to jazz up any look this hands on station lets you mix and match gems, google eyes and face paints to create your own unique makeover. Whether your going for bold and bright or subtle and celestial, you\r in control of your shine!

performances.name: Boogie Bingo
performances.body: Boogie Bingo is what happens when Simon from the game "Simon Says" goes through some serious mind expansion, realizes Bingo is the truth, and combines two of the world’s best games to spread the saving light of bingo. Joined by a rambunctious, glitterly clown crew, Boogie Bingo is silly, wiggly, and serious fun. Part dance party, part game show, Boogie Bingo explodes with wild prizes, spontaneous dance-offs, and full-throttle play-time. It’s a joyful spectacle of chaos, connection, and contagious celebration.

data.name: Tina Berlin, The Dancing Tree Company

performances.name: Tibetan Bowl Sound Journey into the Elements of Shambhala
performances.body: Tina takes it extra old school with the ancient practice using the sound vibrations from the Tibetan Bowls. This then calibrates your system to promote a feeling of connection, ease and vitality. As you lay on the earth, you the listener is then taken on an inner journey of magic and bliss through the ancient wisdom of the bowls and other instruments which can lead to a deeper connection to the elements of this beautiful land. Happy Shambs!

performances.name: Street Dance Concepts
performances.body: Identification and exploration of concepts that exist in Hip Hop and other street dance styles. Fixed Point, Connects & Threads, and Insinuated Movement (IM). IM entails various cause-and-effect and ideational illusion-based movement, which when executed efficiently, may bring new life to the work’s narrative. Learn unique movement vocabulary, foundational techniques and creative troubleshooting. Create intricacy. Paint richness into the movement. Tell a kinesthetic story. Can be applied to freestyle, improvisation and choreography.

performances.name: Balances and Inversions
performances.body: Balance in the human form calls for a trinity of mobility, strength in motion, and technique. Inversions suggest the heart is above the head. This workshop is an all-levels inquiry into balance via influence from the asana of yoga, the rigor of hand balance, and the creative freezes from Breaking (breakdance). Bodies will identify and explore engagement, alignment, microbalance, and [counter]balance. Balance on 1 hand, 2 hands, sits bones, feet and more. Come build foundation and playfully explore approaches, techniques, and games that bring more vibrance to shape-making and inversions. Yoga mats optional. All ages, abilities and levels of experience.

performances.name: Framing A Street Dance Technique
performances.body: A freestyle dance technique using hands to trace lines in space, firstly on the body's own 13-point grid. Framing was informed by street dance styles Hip Hop, Trace Waving, Threading, and Connects, and from the aesthetic and hand performance of Vogue. It opens up a portal for somatic exploration, and a hand-body dialog that increases proprioception and one's relationship with their body. Enhance your solo skills and [optional] contact improv with this unique movement vocabulary, foundational techniques, and creative implementation to freestyle. Framing was developed and codified by Vo Vera, a Bboy and dancer of over 20 years.

performances.name: The Sacred G's Presents: Street Dance Concepts
performances.body: Balance in the human form calls for a trinity of mobility, strength in motion, and technique. Inversions suggest the heart is above the head. This workshop is an all-levels inquiry into balance via influence from the asana of yoga, the rigor of hand balance, and the creative freezes from Breaking (breakdance). Bodies will identify and explore engagement, alignment, microbalance, and [counter]balance. Balance on 1 hand, 2 hands, sits bones, feet and more. Come build foundation and playfully explore approaches, techniques, and games that bring more vibrance to shape-making and inversions. Yoga mats optional. All ages, abilities and levels of experience.

performances.name: Augmented Shambhala
performances.body:
Since 2022, Andrew Hatlen has used 3D Projection Mapping to share unique and engaging perspectives. Irregular shapes and colors appear naturally in the world around us and in the inspiring creations of other artists. Andrew specializes in respectfully borrowing these shapes and colors to create new layers of reinterpretation through temporary projected installations. Playing with depth and color disparity, Andrew uses light as a tool to add augmented layers that breathe new life into existing works of art.

Hours: 7pm-5am

performances.name: Digital Painting
performances.body: Kevin is a digital painter and clothing designer from Denver, CO. With a background in printmaking, he uses Procreate on a large rotating monitor to show the process of constructing his artwork, consisting of natural scenes, geometric patterns, and glitchy transformations. He calls his style Future Retro, and his skill with Procreate is fascinating to witness on his display.

performances.name: Festival Friending Speed Connecting & Conscious Convos
performances.body: Connect with other inspiring humans through fun and thought-provoking small-group discussions, seeded with questions that will make you laugh, think, or both! Minimal cringe - maximum fun. We’ll also take the opportunity to set your intentions for the weekend - how will you make this your best Shambhala yet?! Come solo and make new friends, or show up with your existing crew to deepen your connection. Leave with your roadmap to a magical Shambhala and a new community to share it with. Let’s party with purpose!

performances.body: Drop in, ground yourself, and set powerful intentions for your festival experience through guided meditation, breathwork, and deep connection with the land and community.

performances.name: Authentic Relating- Creating Deep Connections
performances.body: A deep, interactive journey into authentic connection. This workshop teaches you powerful tools to cultivate presence, vulnerability, and deeper intimacy in all your relationships.

performances.name: Authentic Relating: Creating Deep Connections
performances.body: A deep, interactive journey into authentic connection. This workshop teaches you powerful tools to cultivate presence, vulnerability, and deeper intimacy in all your relationships.

performances.name: Root & Rise: Meditation & Intention Setting Ceremony
performances.body: Drop in, ground yourself, and set powerful intentions for your festival experience through guided meditation, breathwork, and deep connection with the land and community.

performances.name: Root Chakra Sound Meditations
performances.body: Ground your energy and drift into a soundscape of stability and strength. Bathed in the deep resonance of Quartz Crystal, Obsidian, Tibetan sound bowls, and Kinga chimes, we’ll journey to the foundation of Muladhara—the root chakra—where safety, belonging, and grounded presence reside. The root is the anchor between body and earth, where fear dissolves into trust and resilience rises from stillness. Through immersive frequencies, we invite tension to release, and the body to remember its steady, rooted nature. Reconnect with the grounding pull of the earth element, and awaken the quiet strength that lives within.Please bring water and anything that supports your comfort—yoga mats, cushions, or blankets are welcome as you relax into this vibrational meditation. Come as you are; leave rooted, calm, and at peace.

performances.name: Heart Chakra Sound Meditation
performances.body: Open your heart and drift into a soundscape of healing and harmony. Bathed in the gentle sounds of Quartz crystals, ancient Tibetan bowls, and Kinga chimes, we’ll journey to the center of Anahata—the heart chakra—where love, compassion, and deep emotional balance reside. The heart is the bridge between earth and spirit, where forgiveness softens sorrow and trust blooms from grief. Through immersive frequencies, we invite old wounds to lift and love to flow freely once more. Reconnect with the breath of the air element, and awaken the quiet joy that lives within. Please bring water and anything that supports your comfort—yoga mats, cushions, or blankets are welcome as you relax into this vibrational meditation. Come as you are; leave lighter, open-hearted, and full of peace.

performances.name: Crown Chakra Sound Meditation
performances.body: Open your mind and drift into a soundscape of clarity and connection. Bathed in the luminous frequencies of Clear Quartz, ancient Tibetan sound bowls, and Kinga chimes, we’ll journey to Sahasrara—the crown chakra—where wisdom, peace, and divine awareness reside. The crown is the gateway between self and spirit, where stillness expands into knowing and the soul remembers its nature and purpose. Through immersive frequencies, we invite mental fog to lift and the heart-mind to open to something greater. Reconnect with the infinite energy of pure consciousness, and awaken the light that lives within. Please bring water and anything that supports your comfort—yoga mats, cushions, or blankets are welcome as you relax into this vibrational meditation. Come as you are; leave clear, connected, and illuminated.

data.name: Nikkicole and Gregory Landry with Puppets On The Move

performances.name: Puppets Got Talent Variety Show
performances.body: Join Puppets on The Move and their charming host, Sasquetti, for an incredibly entertaining and delightful experience. This is an all inclusive interactive puppet game show with talented puppets showcasing their art, as random audience members play the wheel to reveal their own hidden puppet talent with prizes, songs and stories that inspire play and creativity.

performances.name: Super Sock Puppet Rave Buddy
performances.body: This workshop includes a brief sock puppet performance demo with a crankie scroll to help guide you along your creative journey to build your very own raver sock puppet friend! We will have materials, googly eyes, socks and more. Additionally a drawing board with a crankie scroll will encourage fun interactive story telling with our new puppet friends. This is going to be a very one of a kind workshop you do not want to miss! Everyone is invited for a sock puppet after party rave at FRACTAL FUNK JAM.

performances.name: Posture Therapy
performances.body: Posture therapy is focused on realigning your musculoskeletal system to improve functionality, balance and mobility. This modality creates a stable system to keep you dancing longer, harder, minimizes pain & soreness, and reduces accidents & injuries. Where we hurt is not the source of our pain. This sequence of movements ensures the body moves as efficiently as possible so you can stay in the present moment!

performances.name: Somatic Movement & Yoga: The Magic Within
performances.body: Step into a gentle, healing practice that blends somatic movement with mindful yoga to awaken your body’s innate wisdom. This class is all about feeling your way back home — tuning into authentic sensations, softening tension, and inviting a deep nervous system reset. Through flowing, intentional movement and breath, you’ll unlock the magic of presence, restore balance, and nurture true embodiment. Perfect for all levels and anyone craving calm, connection, and self-discovery..

Perfect for all levels and anyone craving calm, connection, and self-discovery..

performances.name: Live Sand Sculpting - Echos in Bloom
performances.body: As sand carvers we have the gift of creating something that is not meant to last, not that anything does. Like the seasons this festival goes through its own transformation, a sort of rebirth each year. As it blooms we are gifted by a diversity of talent, beauty and fun. We want to capture that share it back to everyone. The lotus flower is a symbol of rebirth and the faces the emerge from its pedals represent the diversity and unity.

performances.name: Yoga- Root to Rise = Morning Meditation & Movement
performances.body:
EVERY BODY is welcome in this well-rounded yoga practice that skillfully weaves together strength and stability with openness and ease. We'll explore the natural cycles of contraction and expansion (Spanda) through fluid, intentional movement. This class combines traditional yoga postures with creative sequencing, guiding you to connect deeply with your body, breath, and mind. Expect to delve into the rich practices of Bhakti, Āyurveda, Tantra (including vayus & chakra system), philosophy, mantra, and sacred sound. Come ready to move, breathe, and go with the flow. Suitable for all levels.

Note: This class will be taking place at both the Culture Canopy and the Sunburst Canopy, at the same time, with the same instructor.

performances.name: Bubble Fairy Party
performances.body: It’s bubble time! Join the Bubble fairy in a fantastic display of iridescent magical spheres! We have bubble machines and will be blasting off! Bring your own bubbles if you wish and get in on the action.

performances.name: Embodied Raver Breathwork
performances.body: A gently guided journey through somatic practices that can help you optimize your rave experience, including Breathwork, grounding and body-mind centering. Designed to provide participants with usable tools to use on and off the dance floor to support the nervous system and enhance the ability to connect to self, others, the land, and of course, the music. Christa Rae is a Nakusp BC based singer/songwriter, and trauma-informed breathwork facilitator. Christa’s leadership is filled with compassion, knowledge, and a deep self-knowing. Having been a Shambhala goer for 20+ years, she is stoked to be sharing tools to support others in ‘winning the rave’. Her approach is gentle, playful and always trauma-informed.

performances.name: Farmily Open Mic
performances.body: We know our Farmily is a talented bunch, so here is yet another chance to strut your stuff! Join Christa Rae for a hosted open mic where musicians, poets, writers, and comics can take the stage to showcase their talents. Whether you’re an old pro or just finding your voice, you won’t find a more supportive space to share and connect.

performances.name: Wire wrapping with Damian And Jayeson
performances.body: Join us for a hands-on Wire Wrapping Workshop led by the talented duo Damian and Jayeson! Whether you're a total beginner or looking to sharpen your skills, this playful yet professional session will spark your creativity and teach you the art of turning wire and stone into wearable magic. You'll learn essential techniques, explore unique styles, and leave with your own handcrafted jewelry piece—plus a few laughs along the way. All materials are provided, just bring your curiosity!

performances.name: Acro Yoga Intermediate
performances.body: Emily has been practicing acroyoga since 2014 and teaching regular classes and seasonal workshops in all levels of acroyoga since 2015 in East Van, Canada. She has also performed acroyoga in various venues in Vancouver and Whistler, BC. Emily is also an instructor at a local college and holds an MA in Arts Education. Owen has been a certified yoga teacher since 2021 and has been professionally performing fire dancing and circus arts with clubs and multi staff since 2019. Owen and Emily have been training acroyoga regularly since 2023 at an intermediate and advanced level.

performances.name: Morning Yoga
performances.body:
Join Georgia Aurelia for a soft yet dynamic morning yoga ritual designed to awaken your body and center your mind for a weekend of dance, connection, and celebration. Returning for her third year teaching at Shambhala, Georgia looks forward to seeing all your beautiful faces again. Her classes blend gentle flow and functional strength, perfect for invigorating tired muscles and setting the tone for a magical day ahead.

Note: This class will be taking place at both the Culture Canopy and the Sunburst Canopy, at the same time, with the same instructor.

performances.name: Heart Opening Poetry and Art Share
performances.body: A place to come for a guided meditation to sink into the space to tap into the deeper creative spectrum we all carry within. Followed by by an opportunity to share some art you’ve created or been inspired by. Be it poetry, music, dance, painting or any other medium. We will discuss ‘the creative process’ and what that looks like for each individual. Come be inspired to connect with your inner artist!will have this by tomroow am

performances.name: Hooping 101
performances.body: Hooping 101 is a hulahoop workshop perfect for both beginners and elite flow artists! I will be focusing on teaching isolations and guiding the hoop in a straight line making up a perfect combo for beginners, we will also cover waist hooping and how to keep the hoop spinning on your body! If you are wanting more of a challenge I have tips and techniques for mastering perfect beaks and paddles / shoulder hooping and can help you with any moves you are working on or need help with!

performances.name: ConfiDANCE
performances.body: Confidance is workshop for those that desire to be more confident dancing in social settings like festivals. In this workshop you will learn basic dance moves that you can make your own, you will become more comfortable moving your body in public and you will build confidence around fully expressing yourself while having fun. This is a workshop to empower people to move their body more in a way that feels good to them without judgement or thinking it needs to look a certain way. By the end of this workshop you will feel more confident in your body dancing, learn dance moves that you can take with you anywhere and unlock another level of self expression.

performances.name: Fluid Forms India ink and oil
performances.body: Create your very own psychedelic dreamscape with Tina, she will show you how to combine india ink, paint and oil into your own masterpiece. All materials provided.

performances.name: Tiny Art Communal Paint wall
performances.body: Do you have a small visual story to tell? We want to see it! Come fill in one of the many tiny frames we have mapped out on a gallery wall near the Culture Canopy. Most materials provided but if you have specific paints you prefer you are welcome to bring them. No spray paint please- too stinky.

performances.name: Giant Twister
performances.body: Join SMF Games Hosts Dustin and Amanda for a rotating lineup of delightfully interactive games, pop-up contests, and whimsical experiences designed to spark joy, laughter, and connection in the heart of Downtown Shambhala. From parachute games and UNO tournament to Bingo, karaoke, and spontaneous silliness, this is your invitation to play like a kid and vibe like a festival legend. Whether you’re competing for ridiculous prizes or just making new friends, every session brings something fresh. Inspired by the spirit of Shambhala—creative, kind, and full of surprise—these immersive activations invite you to be part of the magic. Come once or come every day. It’s different every time.

performances.name: Lumen Drift
performances.body:
Discover “Lumen Drift”, a doorway into dreamspace, where a story begins with paint and is transformed by light. This immersive 30-foot mural by artists Kerz and Zeka, in collaboration with projection artist Chris Devious, transforms a static wall into a mesmerizing experience. By day, bold, dynamic visuals form a stunning mural. By night, projection mapped animations bring the artwork to life—revealing hidden narratives through the dance of light. Blending the raw energy of street art with natural forms and anime-inspired storytelling, this one-of-a-kind spectacle weaves mixed media painting, light, and motion into a unified, unfolding experience. It lives between stillness and movement, imagination and reality. Come closer. Drift with it. Let the wall tell you a story that can only exist in this space, in this moment, through these merging mediums.

Hours: 7pm-5am

performances.name: Steez Building Workshop at Camp Dappington
performances.body: Camp Dappington is the summer camp for adults who never grew up. Here festival attendees are enchanted by an interactive experience where they learn to throw down some steezy fingerboard tricks and make friends along the way. We have a mission with Camp Dapps to carve out a niche and define a world with a positive aura. A place that gives music lovers a platform where they can connect with their inner kid, be themselves and have a unique getaway to lose track of time in a fun wholesome activity. We strive to capture the serenity of childhood, giving the opportunity to participate in the here and now wholeheartedly by bringing the fun of skateboarding to all.

data.name: Freida Whales
data.body:
Meet Freida Whales and the Pod, featuring Valerie Rose and Wanda Lust!

With her signature blend of ocean-themed puns, glamour, and camp, Freida Whales is always ready to spread waves of love. This salt-water queen was the recipient of a 2025 Kelowna Civic Award for Honour in the Arts, along with being voted Best Drag Artist in Best of Kelowna for the last five years. She is the owner of the award-winning events company Whalemade Productions.

Looking for a queen who has a whole lot of ass, absolutely no class, and always brings the sass? Look no further than the gorgeous Valerie Rose! Along with winning Kelowna's Next Drag Superstar in 2019, you best be leaf she brings a whole garden full of surprises, from high energy performances, crude humour, and stunts that'll pollenate all over the floor.

Wanda Lust is a captivating performance artist and poet who fell in love with drag while traveling around the globe. From bush doof cabarets in the Australian outback, to the Gender Funk movement in Vietnam. She’s back in Canada, inspired by all the artists she’s met along the way and ready to spread the love of drag. Wanda took home the crown for Kelowna’s Next Drag Superstar in 2024.

data.name: The Troy Story 3
data.body:
For the last 5 years, The Troy Story 3 has been living in the jungles of Costa Rica perfecting his arts of sound and movement with his experiences “Recalibrate Auditory Alignments” and “Assomatic Release Therapy (ART)”.

Trained in different dance and movement modalities from ballet and contemporary, to hip hop and contact improve for the last ten years, Troy has found the beauty of shaking to help release stress and trauma in a fun, sweaty, and exciting way!

While as a musician for several years and lead singer of bands of two very different genres, Troy also grew up in the church culture learning gospel, and has travelled to the ancient sites of India and Egypt to learn more in depth tonalities to stir the soul’s awakening conversation with Spirit.

He rather refers to himself as a sound therapist than healer, as he believes it negates the responsibility of participants to find the courage to heal themselves with the help of unseen forces working for the highest and greatest good.

You can follow him on Instagram at @TheTroyStory3

tracks.title: I Wish I Knew Natalie Portman
I Wish I Knew Natalie Portman
